alert.note: Alert for Catahoula; Franklin; Madison; Tensas (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 7:42AM CDT until August 24 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR CATAHOULA, FRANKLIN, MADISON AND TENSAS PARISHES... At 742 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. At 640 AM, Catahoula Parish Sheriffs Office reported houses flooded in Sicily Island along with multiple roads under water. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tallulah, Winnsboro, Newellton, St. Joseph, Wisner, Waterproof, Newlight, Cooter Point, Helena, Crowville, Lake Bruin, Somerset, Jigger, Lee Bayou, Afton, Enterprise, Wallace Ridge, Sherwood and Mansford. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
